Description: The goal of this session is to review what we know about how risk of specific tumor subtypes and somatic genomic alterations vary by genetic ancestry and what this may teach us about the factors that govern tumor characteristics and outcomes across populations. One major question that will be addressed is how we can identify the causes (environmental, genetic or both) that underlie these differences. Another major question is to what degree do these differences affect outcomes and/or treatment responses. Concepts from human population genetics (genetic ancestry and genetic admixture) will be reviewed. The session is intended for both population scientists and molecular oncologists interested in understanding more about this topic.
SearchResultBody: ED10. Genetic Ancestry, Tumor Subtype and Somatic Genomic Landscape
Title: Genetic Ancestry, Tumor Subtype and Somatic Genomic Landscape
